abstract: University of Texas at Austin will mark 50th anniversary of Charles Whitman's 1966 campus shooting by dedicating memorial to victims on same day it is due to comply with 2015 law legalizing concealed firearms on campus; supporters of law, which University community largely opposes, assert it will deter future assailants.
lead_paragraph: The University of Texas will mark one of the bloodiest campus shootings in U.S. history on the day that a state law permitting concealed firearms on campus takes effect.

headline.main: Texas Marks ’66 Sniper Attack as University Prepares for ‘Campus-Carry’ Law
headline.print_headline: Texas to Mark 1966 Sniper Attack as Looser Gun Law Takes Effect

snippet: The University of Texas will mark one of the bloodiest campus shootings in U.S. history on the day that a state law permitting concealed firearms on campus takes effect....
